page.title: 06CHICHESTER-SHOPPING.
page.content: Shopping within the city is a mixture of old & new, housed in predominantly old buildings. There are family businesses that have been here for many years and branches of regional & national companies. {Smurthwaites }in North Street, established over 200 years, has recently been taken over by C.Brewer. {Arthur Purchase & Son, wine merchants, has been established since 1780. In the residential areas beyond the city walls are local shops to meet the immediate needs of the residents of {Summersdale, Parklands, {St.Pancras, Spitalfield Lane,Portfield and{ Broyle }areas. The autumn of 1985 will see the opening of a new {Sainsbury's Superstore }about 2km from the city centre. This has received opposition from local traders who feel city centre trade will suffer. Others feel it will be of great benefit.
